thread.title: Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready
thread.title_full: Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready

title: Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready
text:
Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready ARLINGTON — With each passing hour, Adrian Beltre’s back has gotten better. Post to Facebook Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready ARLINGTON — With each passing hour, Adrian Beltre’s back has gotten better.  //on.wfaa.com/1LqfxBU   Banister: Beltre to play if he says he’s ready Landon Haaf, WFAA Sports 12:24 a.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Adrian Beltre CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ARLINGTON — With each passing hour, Adrian Beltre’s back has gotten better. 
That according to Rangers manager Jeff Banister. The question Sunday night was, could his condition improve enough in the 17 hours between the end of Game 2 and the start of Game 3 of the American League Division Series against Toronto to be in the starting lineup? 
“We’ll check in with Adrian tomorrow,” Banister said. “We feel like if Adrian comes in and says he’s ready to go, then he’s ready to go." 
Beltre missed games two and three of the ALDS with stiffness in his lower back. He left game one moments after hitting an RBI single. 
The star third baseman was reportedly swinging a bat in the tunnel during Game 2 in Toronto -- a 14-inning affair -- but he didn’t make an appearance. 
Hanser Alberto has gone 2-for-8 starting in Beltre’s place. He hit the go-ahead, two-RBI single in the 14th inning of Game 2 Friday afternoon in Toronto. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1LqfxBU TOP VIDEOS
